quotes.content: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.content: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
quotes.author: Parker Palmer

quotes.content: Myths which are believed in tend to become true.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.content: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.content: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.content: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
quotes.author: Robert Fulghum

quotes.content: The past has no power to stop you from being present now. Only your grievance about the past can do that.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.content: There is nothing happens to any person but what was in his power to go through with.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.content: The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the grandest intention.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.content: Every problem has a gift for you in its hands.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.content: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?
quotes.author: W. Clement Stone

quotes.content: The cautious seldom err.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.content: The most complicated achievements of thought are possible without the assistance of consciousness.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.content: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.content: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: Wisdom begins at the end.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.content: Ignorant men don't know what good they hold in their hands until they've flung it away.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.content: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.content: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.content: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.
quotes.author: Fawn M. Brodie

quotes.content: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.content: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.content: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
quotes.author: Margaret Cousins

quotes.content: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.content: Joy is the best makeup.
quotes.author: Anne Lamott

quotes.content: There never was a good knife made of bad steel.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.content: I love my past. I love my present. Im not ashamed of what Ive had, and Im not sad because I have it no longer.
quotes.author: Colette

quotes.content: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.content: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves... there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
quotes.author: Joan Didion

quotes.content: The power of intuitive understanding will protect you from harm until the end of your days.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.content: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.content: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.content: It is not only for what we do that we are held responsible, but also for what we do not do.
quotes.author: Molière

quotes.content: All difficult things have their origin in that which is easy, and great things in that which is small.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.content: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
quotes.author: Walter Lippmann

quotes.content: So is cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more remains.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
quotes.author: Benjamin Spock

quotes.content: Never promise more than you can perform.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.content: Formula for success: under promise and over deliver.
quotes.author: Tom Peters

quotes.content: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.content: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
quotes.author: Judy Collins

quotes.content: The possibilities are numerous once we decide to act and not react.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.content: It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong, than to be always right by having no ideas at all.
quotes.author: Edward de Bono

quotes.content: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.content: Every one in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
quotes.author: Maria Montessori

quotes.content: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the world.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.content: The first requisite for success is the ability to apply your physical and mental energies to one problem incessantly without growing weary.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.content: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.content: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.content: He that never changes his opinions, never corrects his mistakes, and will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.content: Not what we have but what we enjoy constitutes our abundance.
quotes.author: Jean Antoine Petit-Senn

quotes.content: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.content: A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.content: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.content: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.content: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.content: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am not for others, what am I? And if not now, when?
quotes.author: Rabbi Hillel

quotes.content: If you aren't going all the way, why go at all?
quotes.author: Joe Namath

quotes.content: To go against the dominant thinking of your friends, of most of the people you see every day, is perhaps the most difficult act of heroism you can perform.
quotes.author: Theodore H. White

quotes.content: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.content: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.content: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
quotes.author: Holly Near

quotes.content: Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you're not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.
quotes.author: David Rockefeller

quotes.content: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.content: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
quotes.author: Pema Chödrön

quotes.content: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.content: We can only learn to love by loving.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.content: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.content: Our shared values define us more than our differences. And acknowledging those shared values can see us through our challenges today if we have the wisdom to trust in them again.
quotes.author: John McCain

quotes.content: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.content: There are two kinds of failures: those who thought and never did, and those who did and never thought.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.content: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.content: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: Wisdom is found only in truth.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.content: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
quotes.author: Thomas Aquinas

quotes.content: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.content: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
quotes.author: Walter Benjamin

quotes.content: Our distrust is very expensive.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.
quotes.author: Winifred Holtby

quotes.content: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.content: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.content: When you doubt your power, you give power to your doubt.
quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.content: It is not so important to know everything as to appreciate what we learn.
quotes.author: Hannah More

quotes.content: Keep yourself to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.content: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.content: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance, the wise grows it under his feet.
quotes.author: James Oppenheim

quotes.content: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.content: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.content: A true friend is the most precious of all possessions and the one we take the least thought about acquiring.
quotes.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.content: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.content: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.content: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
quotes.author: Giotto

quotes.content: He that respects himself is safe from others; he wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.content: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: The thought manifests as the word. The word manifests as the deed. The deed develops into habit. And the habit hardens into character.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.content: So much technology, so little talent.
quotes.author: Vernor Vinge

quotes.content: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go, instead, where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracián

quotes.content: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
quotes.author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

quotes.content: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.content: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.
quotes.author: M. Scott Peck

quotes.content: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.content: When we feel love and kindness toward others, it not only makes others feel loved and cared for, but it helps us also to develop inner happiness and peace.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.content: And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.content: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.content: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.content: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Most of the shadows of life are caused by standing in our own sunshine.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: Know that although in the eternal scheme of things you are small, you are also unique and irreplaceable, as are all your fellow humans everywhere in the world.
quotes.author: Margaret Laurence

quotes.content: When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid.
quotes.author: Audre Lorde

quotes.content: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so too.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.content: Every gift from a friend is a wish for your happiness.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept responsibility for changing them.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.content: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
quotes.author: Franz Grillparzer

quotes.content: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
quotes.author: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.content: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
quotes.author: William C. Menninger

quotes.content: Accept challenges, so that you may feel the exhilaration of victory.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.content: Friendship is Love without his wings!
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.content: True friends stab you in the front.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.content: Value your friendship. Value your relationships.
quotes.author: Barbara Bush

quotes.content: There is never enough time to do everything, but there is always enough time to do the most important thing.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.content: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
quotes.author: Bernard Shaw

quotes.content: No one has a finer command of language than the person who keeps his mouth shut.
quotes.author: Sam Rayburn

quotes.content: All that is necessary is to accept the impossible, do without the indispensable, and bear the intolerable.
quotes.author: Kathleen Norris

quotes.content: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.content: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that there was within me an invincible summer.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.content: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.content: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.content: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.content: We need to find the courage to say NO to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
quotes.author: Barbara De Angelis

quotes.content: Be the chief but never the lord.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.content: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.content: The more you know yourself, the more you forgive yourself.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.content: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.content: Build a better mousetrap and the world will beat a path to your door.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
quotes.author: Ansel Adams

quotes.content: Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.content: I can, therefore I am.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.content: The only real valuable thing is intuition.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.content: Liberty, taking the word in its concrete sense, consists in the ability to choose.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.content: If we are not fully ourselves, truly in the present moment, we miss everything.
quotes.author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

quotes.content: I allow my intuition to lead my path.
quotes.author: Manuel Puig

quotes.content: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
quotes.author: Harriet Woods

quotes.content: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.
quotes.author: Ernie Banks

quotes.content: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.content: Whoever is happy will make others happy, too.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.content: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
quotes.author: Jean de La Bruyère

quotes.content: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.content: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
quotes.author: Hal Abelson

quotes.content: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.content: I believe that we are fundamentally the same and have the same basic potential.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.content: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul; the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.content: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.content: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
quotes.author: Napoleon

quotes.content: All men have a sweetness in their life. That is what helps them go on. It is towards that they turn when they feel too worn out.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.content: To dare is to lose ones footing momentarily. To not dare is to lose oneself.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.content: Arriving at one point is the starting point to another.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.content: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.content: The awareness of our own strength makes us modest.
quotes.author: Paul Cézanne

quotes.content: Kind words do not cost much. Yet they accomplish much.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.content: To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.content: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.content: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.content: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
quotes.author: Karl Menninger

quotes.content: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.content: Never idealize others. They will never live up to your expectations.
quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.content: To be aware of a single shortcoming in oneself is more useful than to be aware of a thousand in someone else.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.content: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.content: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.content: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.content: All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon the sand.
quotes.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quotes.content: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.content: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer
William Shakespeare
quotes.content: Action is eloquence!
The heart has its reasons which reason knows not of.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.content: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.
quotes.author: William Saroyan

quotes.content: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.content: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.content: It is better to understand a little than to misunderstand a lot.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.content: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
quotes.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.content: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.content: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.content: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.content: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what youve always gotten.
quotes.author: Tony Robbins

quotes.content: Respect should be earned by actions, and not acquired by years.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.content: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.content: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your reactions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: The universe is full of magical things, patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
quotes.author: Eden Phillpotts

quotes.content: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.content: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.content: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon
